Entry.JapaneseText: ねえ、オークションって何？
主催者が提供する品々に、客が値段を付け、 その額を競い合う。
Entry.EnglishText: It's where customers put prices on the items offered by the proprietor and compete on the sum of money.

Entry.JapaneseText: 最終的に、最も高い値段を付けた者が落札…… つまり、買う事ができる、というものだ。
Entry.EnglishText: In the end, the person who places the highest bid wins the item... Or buys it, in other words.

Entry.JapaneseText: ふえぇ、じゃあ、値段がすっごく 高くなるコトもあるんだネ。
Entry.EnglishText: Phew, so I guess the prices can get pretty up there sometimes.

Entry.JapaneseText: 欲しいと思う人の価値観次第だが、 往々にして高くなりがちではあるな。
Entry.EnglishText: It depends on how much the person values the item, but the bids do tend to run high.

Entry.JapaneseText: ようするに、どうでもいいものを、 高い値段で買おうって事！
Entry.EnglishText: So basically, you can buy things that don't really matter at high prices!

Entry.JapaneseText: 身もフタもない言い方だな……
Entry.EnglishText: That's a rather blunt way of putting it...
